metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40575 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license. Affected versions are subject to an Out-Of-Bounds Read in the `general_YUV444ToRGB_8u_P3AC4R_BGRX` function. This issue is likely down to insufficient data for the `pSrc` variable and results in crashes. This issue has been addressed in version 3.0.0-beta3. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
